original:
In Scotland, David Grisenthwaite has systematically recorded the dates of his lawn mowing since 1984. His data indicates that the first cut of the year occurred 13 days earlier in 2004 compared to 1984, while the last cut was 17 days later. This trend provides evidence for an earlier onset of spring and suggests a general warming of the climate.

National phenological recording in the UK was resumed by Tim Sparks in 1998. Since 2000, th
